page.title: 05LANGTHWAITE FILTER STATION
page.content: The job of the filter station is to filter water and make sure it is fit to drink. The filter station is 42 years old. It has eight filter tanks in it and two pumps, and three soda tanks to clear the water. The water comes from Baystone Bank Reservoir which holds 30,000,000 gallons and covers 7.2 acres. It holds enough water to last 47 days with no water going in to it. The reservoir serves houses and factories in Millom, Haverigg, The Green, The Hill and Silecroft, which all use 2000 cubic metres per day. The caretaker who looks after the station starts work at 8am and finishes at 4.30pm. He pumps the clean water from the filter station to the two storage tanks at Bankhouse and Lowhouse. The present caretaker has been there for 23 years and says he enjoys his job.
